item.title: fhpredict
item.description: This R package provides all functions that are required for the Web application that is developed within the Flusshygiene project.

item.title: Pubs
item.description:

Linking people, publications (in KWB Endnote database) and projects.

item.title: kwb.resilience (v0.1.0): R Package for the Quantification of Technical Resilience
App: hantush
item.description:
Calculation of Groundwater Mounding Beneath an Infiltration Basin

The app is deployed using the free service mybinder.org.

Important note: in order to see the plot in the tab Explore (see screenshot abovce) it is necessary to enable the checkbox Details once after starting the app.

item.title: Digital Water City (DWC)
item.description:
Challenges and Solutions

How to best collect budgets from multiple project partners during the proposal phase?

An EXCEL template was developed by Hauke Sonnenberg, which can be automatically imported into R for data aggregation and analysis.

How to write a data management plan

Christoph Sprenger used the online service DMPonline for creating a data management plan for a task (make groundwater visible) within the DWC project.

item.title: kwb.resilience
item.description:
R Package for the Quantification of Technical Resilience

kwb.resilience allows calculating different resilience indices for time series. Equations are described and discussed in the freely available conference paper by Matzinger et al. (2018) (unfortunately in German only). The sample data for the first example in the paper is also contained in the package as a data.frame “oxygen”.

The package should make a starting point for a broader discussion of approaches to tackle resilience of urban water infrastructure for applied cases. Accordingly, adaptations and suggestions are encouraged!

item.title: App: wtaqWeb
item.description:
Calculation of Groundwater Drawdown Beneath an Abstraction Well

The drawdown calculation is performed with USGS model WTAQ. For creating the WTAQ input files, running the model and reading the output files the R package kwb.wtaq is used.

The app is deployed using the free service mybinder.org.

item.title: kwb.fakin (v0.3.0): R Package with Functions used in the FAKIN Project
netWORKS4
item.description:
Andreas Matzinger had R scripts with functions for assessing the resilience of technical systems.

Within FAKIN this functions were semi-automatically (with the help of the R package kwb.pkgbuild compiled into the R package kwb.resilience, with the following features:

  • Open-source code on Github with MIT license

  • Documentation

  • Continious integretion: automatically checks for each change in the source code, whether the R package can be installed on Windows (Appveyor) and Linux (Travis-CI) platforms

  • Tests: if the implemented R code works as expected using the free service of codecov.io

  • Zenodo DOI and is thus citable

item.title: Flusshygiene
item.description: Hygienically Relevant Microorganisms and Pathogens in Multifunctional Water Bodies and Hydrologic Circles

item.title: kwb.hantush
item.description:
Calculation of Groundwater Mounding Beneath an Infiltration Basin

Calculation groundwater mounding beneath an infiltration basin based on the Hantush (1967) equation. The correct implementation is shown with a verification example based on a USGS report (page 25).
